intro: Inula helvetica, commonly known as European Inula, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, featuring hairy stems and lobed, heart-shaped leaves. Its yellow flowers are arranged in clusters, with ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. The plant is known for its medicinal properties and is often used in traditional herbal remedies.
